description:
The sixth anime series in the Yu-Gi-Oh! franchise. VRAINS is an acronym for "Virtual Reality Artificial Intelligence Network System".

In futuristic Den City, people duel using digital cards in the VR space "LINK VRAINS" managed by SOL Technology, Inc. A mysterious organization known as the Knights of Hanoi hacks into LINK VRAINS in search of a runaway AI program, Ignis. One duelist with the username "Playmaker" stands against this threat. His true identity is high school student Yuusaku Fujiki, a skilled hacker with a dark past and a grudge against Hanoi. When he becomes the first to capture Ignis, a struggle between Yuusaku, SOL Technology, and the Knights of Hanoi ensues.

(Written by Edo)

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
The creator of Yu-Gi-Oh! He loved playing shogi, mahjong, card games, and tabletop role-playing games.

In an interview with Shonen Jump, Takahashi stated that his favorite manga from other authors included Akira by Katsuhiro Otomo, JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by Hirohiko Araki, and Dragon Ball by Akira Toriyama. He also enjoyed reading American comics, with Hellboy being his favorite American comic book character.

On July 6, 2022, a body in snorkeling gear was found off the coast of Nago City, Okinawa, which was identified the following day as Takahashi. It was revealed by a U.S. Army Officer that Takahashi attempted to aid in the rescue of three people at a riptide in Mermaid's Grotto, Onna, on July 4, 2022.

[Website](http://mitsumune.jp/)

Shinkichi Mitsumune is a Japanese composer who writes music primarily for anime. He graduated from Rikkyo University, College of Economics. From the young age of four, he attended the Yamaha Music School and received acoustic training. He started playing the electronic organ at the age of 10 and received tuition from Koichi Oki - a jazz organist while still in junior high school. While at university, he started playing the keyboard for professional bands following which he joined the band of jazz vocalist, Marlene, and toured various jazz festivals across Japan for about two years.

In 1995, he worked on his first anime soundtrack, [Nurse Angel Ririka SOS](https://anilist.co/anime/616/Nurse-Angel-Ririka-SOS/) in which the profound, high-quality and soothing composition performed with a full orchestra garnered high acclaim. This performance was followed by a string of hit anime soundtracks including [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/), [Yu-Gi-Oh!](https://anilist.co/anime/481/YuGiOh/), The series [Rozen Maiden](https://anilist.co/anime/64/Rozen-Maiden/), [Negima!](https://anilist.co/anime/157/Negima/) (2005), The Series [Zero no Tsukaima](https://anilist.co/anime/1195/The-Familiar-of-Zero/) and [Yu-Gi-Oh! VRAINS](https://anilist.co/anime/98231/YuGiOh-VRAINS/).

__[Website](https://bandmaid.tokyo/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bandmaid)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/bandmaid/)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bandmaid.jp/)__

__Formed:__ 2013
__Genres:__ Rock (Hard Rock), Metal (Heavy Metal)

__Introduction:__
Band-Maid, stylized as BAND-MAID and formerly as BAND-MAID®, is a five-piece, all-female Japanese rock group, signed to Gump Records, an imprint of the Shibuya-based Platinum Passport artist management and talent agency, itself a division of Avex Group.

__Biography:__
Since their formation, Band-Maid has regularly performed live at various venues around the Tokyo area. The group released their debut mini-album "MAID IN JAPAN" in January 2014. Later this year, the band released their single Ai to Jōnetsu no Matador ("Love, Passion, Matador" internationally) and in November 2015 their second mini-album "New Beginning" followed. In May 2016 Band-Maid released their third mini-album (and first major label album) "Brand New Maid" and in October and November the band went on their first tour which took them to Mexico, Hong Kong, and six countries in Europe. In January 2017 Band-Maid released their first full-length album "Just Bring It"

__Members:__
[Miku Kobato](https://anilist.co/staff/204236) (小鳩ミク) – rhythm guitar, backing vocals, occasional lead vocals (2013–)
[Kanami Tōno](https://anilist.co/staff/362158/Kanami-Toono) (遠乃歌波) – lead guitar, backing vocals (2013–)
[Akane Hirose](https://anilist.co/staff/362159/Akane-Hirose) (廣瀬茜) – drums, backing vocals (2013–)
[Misa](https://anilist.co/staff/362160/MISA) (ミサ, stylized as MISA) – bass (2013–)
[Saiki Atsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/346854/SAIKI) (厚見彩姫) – lead and backing vocals (2013–)
Around the release of Inazuma Eleven Go vs. Danball Senki W (2012) they worked under Studio Gallop.
Around the release of Inazuma Eleven Go vs. Danball Senki W (2012) they worked under Studio Gallop.
